meanings.definition: To lie in wait for and attack from ambush.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky fox waylays the unsuspecting rabbit in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The bandits waylay travelers on the dark forest path.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat waylays the toy mouse, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Danger waylays in the shadows, ready to pounce at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The ninja waylays his target with precision and stealth.

meanings.sent1: The reporter waylays the celebrity for an impromptu interview.
meanings.sent2: The pickpocket waylays unsuspecting pedestrians in crowded areas.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy waylays its owner with a sudden lick on the face.
meanings.sent4: Opportunity waylays when you least expect it, so be prepared.
meanings.sent5: Curiosity waylays the cat, leading it to explore every corner of the house.
